creditline: Gift of David Tausig Frank and Kazukuni Sugiyama
description: two wooden boxes, outer box is shiny brown and the inner box has a paper lid and a wooden lid; paper under tie; bubble wrap around rollers; fabric is orange; image of a very colorful landscape with mountains in the background and a body of water in the foreground
inscription:
落日蒼天色　寒山啼鳥聲　蕭蕭紅葉下　冉冉白雲生　獨往情無極　高秋老益清　因看明月出　偶訪道人行
{?}
(Setting sunlight darkens heaven\'s color;
cold mountains, sounds of singing birds.
Sighing, soughing, red leaves tumble;
curling, rising, white clouds emerge.
Alone I go forth, feelings without limit:
autumns seem still purer as I grow old.
And now I see the bright moon rising--
this is the time to visit a man of Tao.)
[Jonathan Chaves]
markings: poem UR red seal: 〇〇 [unread #2], LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #1], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #1]; LLC red seal: 我君〇〇〇〇 {?} [unread #1]
signed: 鹿谷隠士古道人 {Rokkoku inshi Kodōjin}
title: Blue-green landscape
